questions.question: What is the problem in this story?

choices.answer: The tribe needs a way to keep warm in the winter
The hunters cannot find enough game in the forests.
Animals are stealing the tribe's winter food supplies.
The Fire Beings are threatening to take over the tribe

questions.question: When Coyote first appears in the story, he keeps a distance from Swift Runner because he____

choices.answer: Wants the boy to play a game
Hopes to avoid helping the boy
Hasn't yet become friends with the boy
Thinks the boy might have brought a hunter

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Coyote on the mountaintop?
Coyote is able to steal a burning stick from the fire mainly because the fire beings.

choices.answer: Dance too wildly on the mountain
Are busy pushing and shoving each other.
Yawn and Stretch as they walk to the teepee.

questions.question: When compared with the fire Beings, Swift Runner is___
This story shows the importance of humans' relationship with ___
The Fire Beings are similar to Coyote and Swift Runner when they____
What most likely happened when Swift Runner arrived at his village with the burning stick?

choices.answer: He was treated as a hero
He became the chief of the tribe.
He found the tribe had moved away

questions.question: How did the tribe most likely act toward Coyote after he gave Swift Runner the fire?

choices.answer: they treated him as a friend

questions.question: Which of the following best expresses an important idea in this story?

choices.answer: Children should not play with fire
Coyotes can run faster than humans.
People should not hunt animals for their fur.
